intro: Ilex fuertensiana, commonly known as the Fuerteventura holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands, specifically the island of Fuerteventura. This evergreen shrub or small tree typically grows to a height of 3 to 5 meters, featuring dense, leathery leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, followed by red berries that are a characteristic feature of the genus Ilex. It is adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat, making it a resilient and distinctive plant of the Canary Islands.
